CatDescriptText: W.M. Work, corporation treasurer, Mt. Lebanon, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 10, 1962, pg. 11 with question: "Do you think a shorter work week is the answer to the job loss posed by automation?" Answer reads: "No I think that as long as a person is able to produce on a 40-hour work week, he should produce.  In other words, the 40-hour work week is nice, it's all right.  If you cut it down, you'll find more persons working two jobs..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of W.M. Work wearing fedora and dark overcoat, posed in front of C.A. Michael, Smithfield Street, Downtown
